content.question: Based on the information provided in Figure 1 and Figure 2, which of the following best explains the effects of a mutation in the promoter of the <math alttext="T Y R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mi>Y</mi><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene that prevents it from being transcribed?

choices.label: <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> damage due to <math alttext="U V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>UV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> radiation will be strongly inhibited, resulting in a positive selection pressure.

<math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> damage due to <math alttext="U V" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>UV</mtext></mrow></math> radiation will be strongly inhibited, resulting in a negative selection pressure.
Skin pigmentation will not be able to change, resulting in a positive selection pressure.
Skin pigmentation will not be able to change, resulting in a negative selection pressure.

content.answer: Skin pigmentation will not be able to change, resulting in a negative selection pressure.

skill.text: 2.C: Explain how biological models relate to larger principles, concepts, processes, systems, or theories.
